# Acknowledgements


## Course Design {.unnumbered}

- [Course environment statements](#course-environment) in syllabus lightly modified from [Chad Topaz](https://chadtopaz.com). 
- [Guiding principles](#guiding-principles) inspired by [Robert Talbert](https://rtalbert.org).

## Content {.unnumbered}

This course on network science is inspired by a number of courses in the area, including: 

- Previous versions of MATH 168 at UCLA as offered by [Mason Porter](https://www.math.ucla.edu/~mason/) and [Heather Zinn Brooks](https://www.hmc.edu/mathematics/people/faculty/heather-zinn-brooks/) (now at Harvey Mudd College). 
- [Patrick Jaillet](https://web.mit.edu/jaillet/www/)'s course 6.268: "Network Science and Models" at MIT. 
- [Aaron Clauset](https://aaronclauset.github.io/)'s course "[Network Analysis and Modeling](https://aaronclauset.github.io/courses/5352/)" at CU Boulder. 

## Website {.unnumbered}

A previous version of this course website was powered by the [bookdown](https://bookdown.org) package for R. It is currently powered by the [Quarto](https://quarto.org) publishing system.
